server.proxies

Interface IServerProxy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockServerProxy, RealServerProxy

    public interface IServerProxy
    Interface for the ServerProxy

    • Method Detail

      • loginUser

        java.lang.String loginUser(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Logs the caller in to the server, and sets their catan.userHTTP cookie. The passed-in username and password may correspond to the credentials of any registered user.
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -

      • registerUser

        java.lang.String registerUser(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password)
        This method does two things: 1) Creates a new user account 2) Logs the caller in to the server as the new user, and sets their catan.userHTTP cookie
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -

      • saveGame

        java.lang.String saveGame(int gameID,
                        java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/saves method to save the state of the game to file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /game/load/ method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/directory.
        Parameters:
        gameID -
        fileName -

      • loadGame

        java.lang.String loadGame(java.lang.String name)
        This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/saves method to save the state of the game to file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /game/load/ method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/directory.
        Parameters:
        name -

      • getGameCurrentState

        java.lang.String getGameCurrentState(int version)
        Returns the current state of the game in JSON format, and also includes a "version" number for the client model.
        Parameters:
        version -

      • resetCurrentGame

        java.lang.String resetCurrentGame()
        Clears out the command history of the current game.
